WiFi connection is never a problem on your home network but sometimes it is a little finicky if you bring it to a different location when first trying to connect it to a new network.  My only real gripe is there is no Amazon Streaming App!!!
author: Dr Nick

review: Sticking with my Roku.Not sure what the big deal is with this.  Bought one just to try it out and see if I was missing something.In terms of ease of use . not even close to Roku.It also seems the video quality is not as good.I used Crackle as a test case.  Using my Windows 7 pc as the client.  I was able to start the movie ... and it wasnt the best experience butI did it.  Then I found I could not pause/stop or control the movie playback in anyway!  Very bad.  Had to reset Chromecast to get it to stop playing.I did think it was cute that I could mirror my cell phone output .  In fact it was a better playback experience with Crackle as at least I couldcontrol the playback as it seemed to strictly mirror the phone.  But again the video quality was so so.Maybe I'm not doing the special thing that Chromecast is better at then Roku ?  It is cheaper I suppose but not by much.  Roku is a much better experience ... and I expect the other similar Roku like devices are as well.
